TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Clayey, smectitic, frigid Lithic Ultic Argixerolls

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON:  Aldi cobbly loam on an east draining valley floor of 2 percent under scattered bitter brush, annual and perennial grasses at 5,800 feet elevation.  (Colors are for dry soil unless otherwise stated.   When described on April 5, 1977, the soil was moist throughout).
01--trace; fresh and slightly decomposed grass and bitterbrush litter.
A1--0 to 8 inches; brown (10YR 4/3) cobbly loam, dark reddish brown (5YR 3/2) moist; weak fine granular structure; slightly hard, friable, nonsticky and slightly plastic; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; 5 percent pebbles;10 percent cobbles; slightly acid (pH 6.5); clear wavy boundary.  (7 to 14 inches thick)
B2t--8 to 18 inches; brown (7.5Y 5/4) clay, loam, dark brown (7.5Y 4/4) moist; moderate medium and coarse angular blocky structure; hard, firm sticky and plastic; few very fine roots; common fine tubular and interstitial pores; many moderately thick clay films on peds and in pores; 5 percent gravel; (pH 7.0); diffuse irregular boundary.  (6 to 10 inches thick)
R--18 to 29 inches; fractured andesite or basalt (some cracks up to 4 inches apart).

COMPETING SERIES.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:  The thickness of the solum and depth to a lithic contact is 4 to 20 inches.  The thickness of the epipedon is 7 to 14 inches.  The soil between depth of about 6 to 20 inches is usually dry all of the time from July 15 until November 1 and is moist in some or all parts the rest of the year.  The mean annual soil temperature is about 43 to 47 F.  Base saturation is 50 to 75 percent throughout the argillic horizon.
The A horizon has dry color of 10YR 3/3; 4/3; 5/2 and 5/3.  Moist colors are 5YR 3/2; 7.5YR 3/2; 10YR, 2/2 and 3/2.  It is or clay loam and has 5 to 10 percent gravel and 10 to 20 percent cobbles.  It is slightly acid to neutral.
The B2t horizon has dry color of 7.5YR 4/4. 5/4; and 10YR 5/3.  Moist colors are 7.5YR 4/4 or 10YR 3/4.  Texture is clay loam or clay and averages 35 to 45 percent clay.  Absolute increase inn clay from the A horizon is less than 20 percent.  It may be gravelly or cobbly and ranges from 5 to 15 percent gravel, and 0 to 20 percent cobbles.  Total rock fragments average less than 35 percent.  It is medium acid to neutral.

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content: COMPETING SERIES:  This is the Alding series.  Alding soils have a moisture control section which is dry in all parts for only 60 to 88 days between mid-July and late September.  In addition Alding soils lack colors of 7.5YR in the B2t horizon and have moist chromas of less than 4.  Alding soils also are formed in colluvium.

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content: GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:  Aldi soils are on gently sloping valley floors and moderately steep to steep mountainside slopes at elevations of 5,000 to 6,500 feet.  Slope ranges from 2 to 75 percent.  These soils formed in material weathered from basic volcanic flows, breccias and agglomerates.   The mean annual precipitation varies from 15 to 35 inches and the mean annual temperature varies from 43 to 47 F.  Mean January temperature is about 27 F and mean July temperature is about 60 F.  The frost-free season is less than 30 days.

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content: GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:  These are the Franktown and Kyburz soils.  Franktown soils have more than 35 percent rock fragments in the control section and do not have an argillic horizon.  Kyburz soils are over 40 inches deep.

USE AND VEGETATION.content: DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY:  Well drained; medium runoff; slow permeability.

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: USE OF VEGETATION:  Used for unimproved range wildlife habitat, watershed and recreation.  Principal species are bitterbrush, sagebrush, annual and perennial grasses.

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT:  Northwestern part of Sierra Nevada Range of California.  The soils are moderately extensive.
